alert.note: Alert for Harris; Meriwether (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 7:53PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Meriwether and northeastern Harris Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 753 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near F.d. Roosevelt State Park, or 9 miles northeast of Hamilton, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Warm Springs, Durand and F.d. Roosevelt State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
